summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The government states it does not seek redactions to 'Exhibit L' of a reply brief and has no objection to its public filing, noting defense counsel also has no objection.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed in the letter regarding the public filing of Exhibit L.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)), the subject of the court proceedings.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who respectfully submits the letter to the court.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is part of the government prosecuting Maxwell in the criminal case.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over Maxwell's criminal case.

events.title: Government's Response on Exhibit L Filing
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a letter with the court stating it does not seek redactions to and has no objection to the public filing of Exhibit L of a reply brief in the Maxwell case.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a formal court letter dated April 22, 2021, from U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
It concerns the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (docket 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The government states it does not seek any redactions to 'Exhibit L' of a reply brief and has no objection to its public filing.
The government has conferred with defense counsel, who also indicated no objection to the public filing of Exhibit L.
The letter is a procedural filing related to the transparency of court records in the Maxwell prosecution.
